column4: i gots a problem with this compiz startup,, getting this error, compiz.real: GLX_EXT_texture_from_pixmap is missing \n compiz.real: Failed to manage screen: 0 \ncompiz.real: No managable screens found on display :0.0
i'm on amd64 processor
ask in #ubuntu-xgl
been asking, no one answers
write isnt too stable yet, and if it is, it'll be in edgy (I think its slated for addition in edgy anyway), it wouldve been released too late for Dapper.
thanks :)
that defeats the purpose of package management
no, it's just to refresh the install, it's postfix, aptitude reinstall won't do what i need
i just need to remove postfix completely without affecting the courier install, then reinstall it immediatly
why aren't you just removing postfix, with it courier, then reinstalling both?
as i have data in courier that i can't get back
removing (just removing, not --purging) doesn't remove any config/etc.  You can always back it up, anyway
don't purge courier, just purge postfix.  (uninstall courier)
ohh, ok, so i can uninstall postfix and allow it to remove courier, then purge postfix, then reinstall postfix and courier
correct.
take it apart, completely.  Wash it with distilled water (the salts in the water can cause problems) and then dry it out completely.
well, right now i have my hard drive in this alternate laptop and i just need the xserver config to work
If you dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg, it should do it.
thanks, i'll try that! :)
#ubuntu+1 for Hardy support, thanks.
ohh, ok,, thanks
